title: IBPS RRB Clerk Prelims Quant (7th Dec Shift 2) #QA017

questions.text: The number of pens is three times the number of pencils, and the number of erasers is 12 less than the number of pens. If the average number of pens, pencils, and erasers is 10, find the number of pens.
questions.solution:
Let the number of pencils $$= x$$. Then, number of pens $$= 3x$$. Number of erasers $$= 3x - 12$$. 
Average $$= \frac{\text{Total}}{3} = 10 \implies \text{Total} = 30$$. 
$$x + 3x + (3x - 12) = 30 \implies 7x - 12 = 30 \implies 7x = 42 \implies x = 6$$. 
Number of pens $$= 3x = 3 \times 6 = 18$$.

questions.text: The quantities of milk in three jars A, B, and C are in the ratio $$4:1:2$$ respectively. The total amount of milk in all three jars together is 28 liters. If 4 liters of milk are added to jar B, find the new ratio of milk in jars A, B, and C respectively.
questions.solution:
Total parts $$= 4+1+2=7$$. 
$$1 \text{ part} = \frac{28}{7} = 4$$ liters. 
Initial quantities: $$A = 16\text{L}, B = 4\text{L}, C = 8\text{L}$$. 
New quantity in B $$= 4 + 4 = 8\text{L}$$. 
New Ratio $$A:B:C = 16:8:8 = 2:1:1$$.

questions.text: A man invested equal amounts in two schemes, Scheme A and Scheme B. Scheme A offers simple interest at 8% per annum for 2 years, while Scheme B offers simple interest at 14% per annum for 2 years. The total simple interest earned from both schemes together is Rs 4,400. Find the amount invested in Scheme A (in Rs).
questions.solution:
Let the investment in each be $$P$$. 
$$SI_A = \frac{P \times 8 \times 2}{100} = \frac{16P}{100}$$. 
$$SI_B = \frac{P \times 14 \times 2}{100} = \frac{28P}{100}$$. 
Total SI $$= \frac{44P}{100} = 4400 \implies P = 10,000$$.

questions.text: Tanisha and Juli started a business together with a total investment of Rs 5,000. After 8 months, Juli left the business. At the end of the year, the profit-sharing ratio of Tanisha to Juli was equal. Find the initial investment of Tanisha (in Rs).
questions.solution:
Let Tanisha's investment $$= x$$. Juli's investment $$= 5000 - x$$. 
Tanisha time $$= 12$$ months, Juli time $$= 8$$ months. 
Ratio $$= (x \times 12) : ((5000-x) \times 8) = 1:1$$. 
$$12x = 40000 - 8x \implies 20x = 40000 \implies x = 2000$$.

questions.text: A train crosses a platform in 21 seconds while running at a speed of $$72 \text{ km/h}$$. The length of the platform is 60 meters more than the length of the train. Find the length of the train (in meters).
questions.solution:
Speed $$= 72 \times \frac{5}{18} = 20 \text{ m/s}$$. 
Total Distance $$= 20 \times 21 = 420 \text{ m}$$. 
Let Train $$= L$$, Platform $$= L + 60$$. 
$$L + (L + 60) = 420 \implies 2L = 360 \implies L = 180$$.

questions.text: The monthly incomes of Mahesh and Hari are in the ratio of 5:6 respectively. Mahesh spends 20% of his income on rent, 25% of the remaining amount on EMI, and 10% of the remaining amount on food. He saves the rest of his income. If Mahesh's savings amount to Rs 13,500, find the monthly income (in Rs) of Hari.
questions.solution:
Let Mahesh's income $$= 5x$$. 
Remaining after Rent $$= 5x \times 0.8 = 4x$$. 
Remaining after EMI $$= 4x \times 0.75 = 3x$$. 
Savings (after Food) $$= 3x \times 0.9 = 2.7x$$. 
$$2.7x = 13500 \implies x = 5000$$. 
Hari's Income $$= 6x = 30000$$.

questions.text: The present ages of two sons together are equal to the present age of their father. Three years ago, the age of the elder son was half of his father's age at that time. If the present age of the younger son is 23 years, then find the age (in years) of the father after 1 year from now.
questions.solution:
Let Elder $$= E$$, Father $$= F$$. $$E + 23 = F$$. 
3 years ago: $$E - 3 = \frac{1}{2}(F - 3) \implies 2E - 6 = F - 3 \implies F = 2E - 3$$. 
Substitute F: $$E + 23 = 2E - 3 \implies E = 26$$. 
$$F = 26 + 23 = 49$$. 
Age after 1 year $$= 50$$.

questions.text: The area of a rectangle is $$98 \text{ cm}^2$$, and the breadth of the rectangle is half of its length. Find the sum of the length and breadth of the rectangle (in cm).
questions.solution:
Let $$L = x$$, $$B = \frac{x}{2}$$. 
Area $$= x \times \frac{x}{2} = 98 \implies x^2 = 196 \implies x = 14$$. 
$$L = 14, B = 7$$. Sum $$= 21$$.

questions.text: A can complete a piece of work in 20 days, and B can complete the same work in 30 days. Working together, A, B, and C can finish the work in 10 days. Find the number of days C alone would take to complete the work.
questions.solution:
Total Work $$= 60$$. $$A = 3$$, $$B = 2$$. 
$$A+B+C = \frac{60}{10} = 6$$ units/day. 
$$C = 6 - (3+2) = 1$$ unit/day. 
Time for C $$= \frac{60}{1} = 60$$ days.

questions.text: A shopkeeper marks the price of an article 50% above its cost price and allows a 20% discount on the marked price. If the profit earned is Rs 40, find the discount allowed (in Rs).

$$\text{Direction:} The table given below shows the number of guest and number of rooms in five different hotels.
 guests living in 2/3rd of the rooms in D. find the remining number of guests living in per room in D.
questions.infoHtml:
HotelsNumber of roomsNumber of guests
A3472
B3951
C5260
D3977
E40100
questions.solution:
Total rooms in D = 39. Total guests in D = 77.
Rooms occupied by 51 guests = $$\frac{2}{3} \times 39 = 26$$.
Remaining rooms = $$39 - 26 = 13$$.
Remaining guests = $$77 - 51 = 26$$.
Guests per remaining room = $$\frac{26}{13} = 2$$.

questions.text: Find the ratio of number of rooms in A to number of rooms in E.
questions.solution:
Rooms in A = 34.
Rooms in E = 40.
Ratio = $$34 : 40 = 17 : 20$$.

questions.text: If number of guests in F is average of guests in A & C and number of rooms in F is 20% less rooms in E. Find the number of guest and rooms in F.
questions.solution:
Guests in F = Average(A, C) = $$\frac{72 + 60}{2} = \frac{132}{2} = 66$$.
Rooms in F = $$40 \times (1 - 0.20) = 40 \times 0.8 = 32$$.
Answer: 66, 32.

questions.text: Number of guests in B is what percentage of number of guests in C.
questions.solution:
Guests in B = 51.
Guests in C = 60.
Percentage = $$\frac{51}{60} \times 100 = \frac{17}{20} \times 100 = 17 \times 5 = 85\%$$.

questions.text: Find the wrong number in the given series: $$12000, 6000, 3000, 1500, 750, 325$$
Find the wrong number in the given series: $$1.5, 3, 29, 117, 469, 1877, 7509$$
Find the wrong number in the given series: $$160, 173, 190, 209, 232, 260, 292$$
questions.solution:
Differences: $$+13, +17, +19, +23$$ (Consecutive primes). 
Next difference should be $$+29$$. 
$$232 + 29 = 261$$. 
The number 260 is wrong.

questions.text: Find the wrong number in the given series: $$285, 281, 265, 229, 160, 65$$
Find the wrong number in the given series: $$10, 1343, 2343, 3072, 3584, 3927, 4143$$
What will come in place of (?): $$(66\% \text{ of } 600)\% \text{ of } 25 = ?\% \text{ of } 50$$
What will come in place of (?): $$\frac{7}{16} = \frac{7}{2} \times \frac{1}{343} \times 49 \times ?$$
questions.solution:
$$\frac{7}{16} = \frac{7 \times 49}{2 \times 343} \times ?$$ 
$$\frac{7}{16} = \frac{343}{686} \times ? = \frac{1}{2} \times ?$$ 
$$? = \frac{7}{16} \times 2 = \frac{7}{8}$$. 
*(Note: Based on the provided PDF solution S67, the answer key indicates option (a) 4, implying a potential typo in the source question or `?` being squared inverse, but derived answer is 7/8)*

questions.text: What will come in place of (?): $$676^{1/2} - 224 + 200 = ?$$
What will come in place of (?): $$22 \times 25 + 400 = ?$$
What will come in place of (?): $$220\% \text{ of } 250 + 60\% \text{ of } 550 = ? \times 8$$
What will come in place of (?): $$25\% \text{ of } 320 + 40\% \text{ of } 250 + 33\frac{1}{3}\% \text{ of } 30 = ?$$
What will come in place of (?): $$16 \times 16 \div 64 = ?$$
What will come in place of (?): $$520 + 480 - 200 = ? \times 8$$
What will come in place of (?): $$[2 \times \{42 + 10\}] = ?$$
What will come in place of (?): $$600 + (45 \times 16) - ? = 25$$
What will come in place of (?): $$4570 + 430 - ?^2 = 50^2$$
What will come in place of (?): $$\sqrt{1225} + \sqrt{196} = ?^2 + 24$$
What will come in place of (?): $$4500 + ? = 2500 + 3500 - 300$$
What will come in place of (?): $$3 \frac{1}{2} + 4 \frac{1}{2} - 2 \frac{1}{4} = ?$$
What will come in place of (?): $$\frac{25}{69} \times \frac{23}{5} \times \frac{1}{25} = \frac{?}{15}$$
